intro: Conophytum indutum, commonly known as the "Laceleaf Stonecrop," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically pale green with a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Conophytum indutum is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
